title: Top 10 Things to Do on BC Family Day in Vancouver
text:
10 Things to Do on BC Family Day in Vancouver, BC The Best Family Activities and Special Events on BC Family Day By Dana Lynch Updated January 29, 2016 . 
BC Family Day is this February 8, 2016 , and there are lots of special events and family activities happening around Vancouver for the holiday. Use this list of the Top 10 Things to Do on BC Family Day in Vancouver to find the perfect activity for you and your family! Robson Square Ice Rink at night. Image Courtesy of Tourism Vancouver 1. Free Ice Skating at Robson Square 
One of the top free things to do on BC Family Day in Vancouver is skate at the Robson Square Ice Rink, Vancouver's only outdoor ice skating venue. Free ice skating at Robson Square runs through February 28, 2016, including 9am-9pm on BC Family Day (February 8). Skate rentals are $4; cleats and helmets are $2. 
continue reading below our video Before Your Road Trip, Watch This BC Family Day at Grouse Mountain. Image Courtesy of Grouse Mountain 2. Half-Price Lift Tickets & Family Activities on Grouse Mountain 
Grouse Mountain celebrates BC Family Day with half-priced lift tickets and general admission tickets for all BC residents, plus multiple family events, including family photo ops, kids' activities, and special family-friendly terrain parks. Sea to Sky Gondola. Photo by Paul Bride 3. Half-Price Tickets at the Sea to Sky Gondola 
In honour of BC Family Day, the Sea to Sky Gondola in Squamish (about an hour north of Downtown Vancouver) is offering half-price tickets (50% off the regular price) on February 8. Families can take a ride 885 metres above the Howe Sound to a winter playground, enjoy snowshoeing or tubing, and finish with a fondue chocolate treat at The Summit Lodge restaurant. 
Learn more: BC Family Day at the Sea to Sky Gondola 4. Vancouver Giants Family Day Game 
Sponsored by Telus and in celebration of BC Family Day, the Vancouver Giants play the Edmonton Oil Kings on February 8 at 2pm. This annual event is one of the top things to do on BC Family Day in Vancouver, since it lots of family activities throughout the game. 
Tickets & Info here: Vancouver Giants Family sleepovers at the Vancouver Aquarium. Image Courtesy of the Vancouver Aquarium 5. Family-Themed Sleep Over at the Vancouver Aquarium 
A visit to the Vancouver Aquarium is definitely one of the best things to do on BC Family Day in Vancouver, but it can also be a special event the night before: The Aquarium's Arctic Exploration night is a family-themed after-hours / sleep over event that includes interactive play, "ocean themed experiments," and a chance to spend the night with the Belugas. Happens February 7, 2016. Vancouver Art Gallery, during 2009's Cultural Olympiad. Image Courtesy of Tourism Vancouver/Coast Mountain Photography 6. Free Kids' Admission at the Vancouver Art Gallery 
The Vancouver Art Gallery celebrates BC Family Day with free admission for kids 12 and under, live music, tours and hands-on art making activities. Science World's Eureka Gallery. Image Courtesy of Tourism Vancouver/ Science World British Columbia 7. Vancouver Attractions for Kids 
Lots of the top Vancouver Attractions for Kids--including Science World --have special activities and events planned for BC Family Day. Use my guide to the best attractions for kids to decide which attraction to visit on February 8, 2016. The Free Lynn Canyon Suspension Bridge. Image via Wikipedia 8. Explore the Top 10 Things to Do with Kids in Vancouver 
It's easy to find things to do in Vancouver with kids. There are loads of free activities, parks and beaches to visit, places to bike and hike, fun and educational things to do on a rainy day, family-friendly museums and Vancouver attractions, and much, much more! Woodland Park Zoo in Seattle, WA. Image Courtesy of Woodland Park Zoo 9. Take a Family Weekend Getaway or Day Trip 
Vancouver is perfectly situated for a wide range of day trips and weekend getaways. The Best Vancouver Day Trips take you to some of the most breathtaking scenery in the Pacific Northwest, to some of North America's top ski and snowboard resorts, to picturesque villages and historic cities for shopping and strolling, and to the best spots for outdoor recreation, including camping, hiking, kayaking, skiing, and more.
